reviewTitle: Great Value for Money and Highly Portable
reviewDescription: Really impressed with this small Bluetooth speaker! It offers excellent value for money, and its portability is a major plus. The battery backup is outstanding, allowing for hours of continuous playtime. It‚Äôs lightweight and easy to carry around, making it perfect for on-the-go use.The sound quality is more than sufficient for a small room, with surprisingly good bass for its size. I‚Äôm really happy with this purchase.The only minor downside is the button design‚Äîit‚Äôs a bit tricky to distinguish between the volume and power buttons. I hope Mivi can improve this in future models. Despite this small issue, I‚Äôm giving it 5 stars because the positives far outweigh it. If this one aspect is improved, these could easily be the best speakers in their category.

=======================================================================UPDATE - 15th July 2021After using this speaker for few days, I'm downgrading rating to 3. Why?Zoom Bluetooth volume is too low for laptop, AUX sound clarity and volume not good with laptop and phone. I was mostly looking for a handsfree speaker with my laptop and it was a huge disappointment, infact I tried with 2 laptops. My old JBL GO is twice as loud when using Zoom. However with music over bluetooth on phone I like it and it's better than my JBL GO, but I don't need this MIVI for listening to music, I got far better speakers.========================================================================I came to know about this brand 'MIVI' through some online reviews. They claim that from design to manufacturing, it's completely made in India. 'MIVI' might be among the handful of speakers that's made in India. Good job!Coming to the product 'MIVI Play', it's a compact bluetooth speaker. I got it for the inaugural price, it's a good deal. I'm an audiophile and I got expensive WiFi/Bluetooth speakers like Bose Soundtouch 20, Marshall Stanmore and audiophile grade speakers from Elac, Klipsch and Q Acoustics.Let me put down the pro's and con's of this little one.PRO's1. I liked the design. It's simple and cute.2. Build quality is good for the price you pay. Can't expect more at this price.3. I liked the sound signature of this tiny speaker.4. Good bass from this tiny speaker, better than JBL GO.5. It got 4 small rubberized legs, it isolates the vibration. More like isolations stands, great idea.6. Stereo mode with 2 MIVI Plays, I got only one hence cannot say about. However I'll not recommend a stereo pair with this speaker since sound output is low.7. Its cheap! I can get more than 30 of these at the price of my Marshall Stanmore.CON's1. Beyond 80% volume, its noise. Lot of distortion and its sounds awful.2. Micro USB port. In 2021 they should have provided USB C type.3. Sound separation not good, can't expect much at this size and price.4. Tried with Zoom and audio was poor. Surprisingly my laptop build in speaker was louder than this speaker.Overall its a good attempt by MIVI. I didn't like the distortion at higher volumes, probably they wanted to keep the price under check. Can't say about battery backup since I just got it today.Will I recommend it? Yes, at this price you get quality sound but remember not more than 80% volume.

reviewTitle: Capable enough for the price point.
reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
        
    
    








  
  
    ¬†1.) The speaker is decently good for the price  point it comes at but do not expect to be  blown away by it. The range of volume is  pretty pathetic tbh. You practically cannot  hear it below 50% volume. It's meant to be  operated at a range of 70/80-100% volume.2.) There's no cracking at higher volumes, even  after long hours of play, which is  commendable. The sound is clear and the  background scores are also distinguishable  from the vocals. The sound clarity might not  be comparable to the likes of Bose or Sony,  but until or unless you've experience with  expensive speakers, you won't be able to  notice the difference.3.) The battery life is respectable and the build  quality is sturdy. No shaky finishes and  product though cheap, doesn't feel like one.Overall it's the best deal available if you're looking for a sub 1000 rupees speaker. There are avenues for some improvement, but kind of makes you feel ashamed to even complain at this price point..

reviewTitle: Good sound at a modest price
reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    ¬†Don't let the price fool you. This is a decent speaker. I would rate the sound quality as 4/5. This speaker is good enough to listen to music. Mids and lows are okay. Loudness is good, unlikely you would be playing this at full volume. Distortion is minimal at max volume. This speaker isn't meant for an audiophile. If I had to compare it to my Panasonic music system (5.1 speakers) or Anker soundcore mini, those would score a notch above in terms of sound quality, but those cost 5 times more. So sound quality and affordability together, this speaker is unbeatable. Would I buy this again - 50% likely.
Good product in this price

reviewTitle: It doesn‚Äôt come with a USB-C, and the included charging cable is super short.
reviewDescription: Product Review: Mivi Play Bluetooth Speaker with 12 Hours Playtime.Sound Quality: The sound quality is genuinely impressive! The bass hits nicely, and the audio is clear and balanced. It‚Äôs perfect for music, podcasts, and even movie nights.Battery Life: Battery performance is decent, lasting a good amount of time for a portable speaker.Charging Issue: Only drawback is the outdated charging port. It doesn‚Äôt come with a USB-C, and the included charging cable is super short, which makes it tough to charge comfortably unless you‚Äôre right next to an outlet.Overall: Great speaker for the price! If they updated to USB-C and included a longer charging cable, this would be nearly perfect.
Would be great product If it had type C port
